intro: Speirantha, commonly known as the lesser bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plants are typically herbaceous, with opposite leaves and often grow in moist, woodland environments. Speirantha species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including North America and Europe. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in shaded conditions.
